intro: Alguelaguen hieronymi, commonly known as the Hieronymi's algea, is a unique species of green algae belonging to the family Ulvaceae. It is characterized by its filamentous structure and ability to thrive in freshwater environments. This algae typically grows on submerged or emergent surfaces, such as rocks and aquatic plants. Its cellular structure includes chloroplasts that enable photosynthesis, and it plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by contributing to nutrient cycling. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is often found in relatively undisturbed, nutrient-rich waters.
